Mayoral Goose Proposes 'Great Honkening,' City Forgets Why

By Barnaby Finch, Editor-in-Chief

"It's loud, it's decisive, and it involves... well, honking."In a rousing speech delivered from atop the Fountain of Perpetual Confusion, Mayor Goose unveiled plans for the 'Great Honkening,' a city-wide initiative slated to begin this Thursday. The proposal, which was met with a mixture of applause and vacant stares, is said to be the cornerstone of the administration's new five-minute plan. While details remain hazy, sources close to the Mayor's office confirm the event will be "loud, decisive, and involve... well, honking."

When pressed for the specific purpose of the Honkening, the Mayor’s chief-of-staff, a goose who only identifies as 'Kevin,' took a long sip of puddle water before stating, "Purpose is a human construct. We are geese. We honk." He then attempted to eat this reporter's microphone. The Quality Control Feline Corps has expressed 'cautious pessimism,' noting that unscheduled, mass honking could disrupt afternoon nap schedules by as much as 14%. A formal impact report is expected, provided the lead analyst, Patches, wakes up.

Sunbeam Quality Plummets 12% in Sector 4

By Mittens, Data Purr-nalist

A troubling trend has emerged from the latest Quality Control report. The average Lux and Warmth Rating (LWR) for sunbeams in Sector 4 has dropped a staggering 12% since last Tuesday. "The motes are simply not dancing with their usual vigor," stated a senior QC inspector, who wished to remain anonymous for fear of being petted. "Nap efficiency is down, and morale is at an all-time low. It's a catastrophe." The Geese Municipal Board has blamed 'clouds,' a controversial theory with little scientific backing.

The Perfect Cardboard Box: A Review

By Esmeralda Fluffen-Smythe, Lifestyle Editor

A deep dive into this season's must-have domicile.

Forget the overwrought excesses of wicker baskets or the tragic transparency of plastic bins. This season, dear reader, is all about the humble, yet sublime, cardboard box. I recently acquired a 'Slightly Crushed Amazon Prime Box (Medium)' and it is, without exaggeration, a triumph.

Structural Integrity: 4/5 Paws. While one corner shows evidence of a 'spirited delivery,' the main chassis is robust, offering excellent defense against sudden breezes and the curious prodding of a goose beak.

Ambience & Odor Profile: 5/5 Paws. A delicate bouquet of warehouse dust and that indefinable, yet alluring, scent of 'potential.' It whispers tales of distant factories and grand adventures.

If It Fits, I Sits Factor: 5/5 Paws. The dimensions are exquisite. Just tight enough to feel like a secure embrace, yet spacious enough for a full 270-degree turn. A masterpiece.

Opinion: Are We Geese, Or Are We Dancers?

By A Goose of Some Repute

The question haunts my waking moments, which are admittedly brief and often interrupted by an urge to nibble at interesting blades of grass. We move with a certain rhythm, a choreography of chaos across the manicured parks of this forgotten city. Is the waddle not a dance? Is the honk not a song? When I chase a small human for their sandwich, is it base instinct, or is it performance art? The cats, with their judgmental stares, they do not understand. They are the critics, not the artists. We are the soul of this city. A loud, confusing soul.

Corrections & Clarifications

• A previous issue stated that the sky is blue. After further review and extensive staring, the Feline Quality Council has determined it is, in fact, 'sky-colored.' The Gazette regrets the error and the subsequent existential crisis it caused one of our interns.

• In our review of the 'Perfect Cardboard Box,' we referred to the scent of 'warehouse dust.' The manufacturer has informed us the correct term is 'artisanal transit particulates.' We are happy to clarify.

• Kevin, the Mayor's chief-of-staff, did not eat our reporter's microphone. He merely 'aggressively sampled its textural profile'.
